creator: dgarcia@silentnoise.org
text:
If I have a 'default' context (e.g. <Context Path=""/>) - that isn't in a virtual Host, the serverName doesn't appear to be maintained in the event of, say, an include.  Turning on debug in the SimpleMapper1 gave me :

2001-04-30 05:35:00 - ContextManager: Host = homestore.dev.domania.com

during the initial request and then gave me:

2001-04-30 05:35:31 - ContextManager: Host = localhost

when I tried to do an include.  However, if I had a virtual host set up, say "bandcamp" I would get:

  2001-04-30 05:36:13 - ContextManager: Host = bandcamp

for the request and 

2001-04-30 05:36:14 - ContextManager: Host = bandcamp

for the include.

I would imagine that in most cases, this wouldn't cause an issue - but it just so happened, in this particular case, that I had a virtual host definition for "localhost" that was pointing at a different location that the default context - and so the includes were failing.  My particular issue was taken care of by getting rid of the virtual host definition for "localhost" .

Note: request.getServerName() always reported the correct server name, even in the included files.

The bug should be fixed in the latest beta for 3.2.2. Please check and reopen
the bug if not.
Fixed in 3.3
